subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The Lean Startup: Learning to Fail Cheaply
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Lean Startup: Learning to Fail Cheaply usable.

hook.text: Eric Ries spent two years building a product nobody wanted. That painful mistake became a global movement.

buildup.text: His startup IMVU spent months perfecting features. When they finally launched, users were confused and left.

discovery.text: Ries realized they should have tested a rough version firstâ€”the minimum viable product was born.

twist.text: The Lean Startup book became Silicon Valley's bible. VCs started demanding MVPs before writing checks.

climax.text: Dropbox launched with a fake demo video. Zappos tested demand by buying shoes from stores and reselling.

punchline.text: The fastest way to succeed is to fail cheaply first.

quiz.question: What is the core principle of Eric Ries's Lean Startup methodology?
options: Spend as little money as possible on every aspect of the business
Test a minimum viable product with real users before building the full version
Launch with a perfect product to make a strong first impression
